summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney to defense attorney Sigrid McCawley notifying her of two upcoming court appearances in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell: an in-person arraignment on April 23, 2021, and a remote oral argument for a bail appeal on April 26, 2021.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Recipient of the email notification regarding upcoming court dates in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Scheduled the in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell', subject to an upcoming arraignment and bail appeal hearing.

connections.description: McCawley is the defense attorney receiving notification of court dates for her client, Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the arraignment in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An in-person arraignment scheduled by Judge Nathan at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: A remote oral argument scheduled by the Second Circuit Court of Appeals at 10 a.m. regarding the defendant's bail appeal.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment was scheduled for April 23, 2021, in the Southern District of New York.
A bail appeal oral argument was scheduled for April 26, 2021, in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.
The correspondence is official notification from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the defense counsel regarding court proceedings.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell in early 2021.
